title: Is it true that all Muslims in Spain were killed? - Quora

response.answer_text: It’s not true, no. From a different answer I once wrote on here, “ …after the Reconquista [around 1490s/1492 approximately, that is; the final fall of the last Islamic kingdom in far southern Spain] about 100 yrs later the Spanish King and Spanish Catholic religious authorities at the time began to crack down more and more against what was left of Islamic (or ‘crypto-Islamic’) or even just Arabic-inclined cultural practices and communities there. Culminating in basically a countrywide expulsion event in the 1600’s. Which apparently met varying levels of ‘success’ ranging from (some scholars estimate) around 40 or 50% ‘successful expulsion’ rate, to as high as near-complete expulsion particularly in the Valencia region for example. “These heavily de-populated regions were then sometimes (or often) basically re-populated with what they called ‘Old Christians’. That is, people from the more northerly parts of Spain, whose ancestors had never been Muslims or converts from Islam into (or ostensibly ‘back into’) Catholicism — and therefore were not at all religiously ‘suspect’.” Basically then, as you can see, perhaps around half (very very roughly speaking) or more than half of the Muslims in Spain were expelled from Spain in the first quarter or so of the 1600’s. In some parts of the country, the expulsion rate was quite higher however, or near complete (Valencia was mentioned). They mostly went to northern Africa. But the Spanish Muslims who were killed would have been those who fell in battles over the many many years of the actually centuries-long (rather ‘gradual’) “re-conquest”, fighting against the Spanish Catholics. There was not a Muslim mass-extermination event however, following the culmination of the reconquest. There was more so a mass-expulsion.

No, Not all were Muslims were Killed during the Inquisition. All of them were tried to be converted forcefully to Christianity. There ensued 4 different results: Didn't accept and were burned on the stake.Didn’t accept and fled to Africa.Accepted Christianity on the outside but rejected it at home and remained safe but still stripped of many privileges because of being former Muslims.Accepted Christianity on the outside but rejected it at home but were burned on the stake.Thanks.
